Article Title: Elon Musk gets February 15 deadline from 'Upset' European Union: Provide internal paperwork to ...
Article Text:
Investigation goes back to December 2023

The European Union (EU) seems quite 'upset with Elon Musk. The political bloc of 27 European nations is intensifying its investigation into Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter), demanding greater transparency regarding its algorithms. This move comes amid heightened scrutiny of Elon Musk 's public pronouncements on European politics, which have fueled calls for stronger EU action.The European Commission, the EU's digital regulator, is under pressure from EU lawmakers to address concerns about X potentially manipulating its platform to amplify far-right content and politicians. This follows Musk's controversial statements on some European leaders and his support for Germany's far-right AfD party.The investigation, initiated in December 2023 under the Digital Services Act (DSA), focuses on how Twitter handles illegal content and disinformation. The EU has now specifically requested internal documentation on Twitter's recommender systems—the algorithms that personalize content for users—and any recent modifications made to them by February 15.Furthermore, X is required to preserve all internal records concerning planned changes to its recommender algorithms from January 17 to December 31 of this year, unless the investigation concludes sooner. The EU also seeks access to certain commercial APIs, which would facilitate independent analysis of content moderation and account virality.EU tech chief Henna Virkkunen emphasized the importance of these steps in assessing systemic risks and their mitigation under the DSA. The Commission aims to ensure X complies with EU legislation designed to create a fair, safe, and democratic online environment.Musk has criticized the DSA as a form of censorship. The law, fully implemented in February 2023, represents the EU's efforts to regulate large tech companies.Despite accusations of political influence, particularly from the Trump administration, the EU maintains that its enforcement actions are impartial. In July 2024, the EU formally accused X of misleading users with its blue check verification system, lacking advertising transparency, and denying researchers access to platform data. An EU spokesperson reiterated that the latest demand for algorithmic transparency is entirely independent of any political considerations or recent events.
Article Summary: The European Union (EU) seems quite 'upset with Elon Musk. The political bloc of 27 European nations is intensifying its investigation into Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) This move comes amid heightened scrutiny of Elon Musk's public pronouncements on European politics.

Article Title: Bumble CEO Lidiane Jones resigns, founder to lead dating app company
Article Text:
Whitney Wolfe Herd to become the chief executive from mid-March

Bumble has announced that Lidiane Jones resigned as CEO and founder Whitney Wolfe Herd will be returning to the role of the chief executive. The transition will complete in mid-March and till then, Jones will be at the helm of the dating app company.Jones, former CEO of Salesforce's Slack, stepped down for personal reasons.“Bumble has made tremendous progress over the past year in building a platform for renewed, sustainable growth, and I will be forever proud of the work we’ve done for this beloved global brand.It has been an honor to serve Bumble’s stakeholders, and I will remain an enthusiastic supporter of Whitney and the Company, especially the outstanding team behind the brand,” Jones said.Wolfe Herd said that she was grateful for Lidiane's leadership and the strong foundation she has built for Bumble's future.“As I step into the role of CEO, I’m energized and fully committed to Bumble’s success, our mission of creating meaningful, equitable relationships, and our opportunity ahead. We have exciting innovation ahead for Bumble in this bold new chapter,” said Wolfe Herd.Founded in 2014 by Wolfe Herd, Bumble is a dating app known for empowering women by encouraging them to make the first move. The company went public in 2021 with a strong market debut, but its market capitalization has since declined significantly, from $7.7 billion to approximately $847 million.Meanwhile, Ann Mather, currently serving as lead director, will succeed Wolfe Herd as Chair of the Board of Directors.“On behalf of the Board, I want to thank Lidiane for her significant contributions. She has played a vital role in positioning Bumble to create long-term value as the team continues to transform the customer experience for new generations of people seeking connections and love,” Mather added.“We are fortunate to have a passionate and engaged founder in Whitney to drive Bumble’s vision as the Company accelerates the execution of its strategy,” Mather said.
Article Summary: Whitney Wolfe Herd to become the chief executive from mid-March. Jones, former CEO of Salesforce's Slack, stepped down for personal reasons. Bumble is a dating app known for empowering women by encouraging them to make the first move.

Article Title: Blinkit gets Rs 500 crore Zomato ‘boost’
Article Text:
Quick commerce competition intensifies

Gurgaon-based food delivery giant Zomato has further invested Rs 500 crore in its quick-commerce subsidiary, Blinkit, according to a recent regulatory filing. This brings Zomato's total investment in Blinkit to Rs 2,800 crore since acquiring the company in an all-stock deal worth Rs 4,477 crore in August 2022.The investment follows Zomato's recent Rs 8,500 crore capital raise through a qualified institutional placement (QIP), which the company stated would be used to strengthen its balance sheet amidst intensifying competition in the quick-commerce sector.Blinkit faces stiff competition from key players like Swiggy Instamart, which recently went public, and Zepto, backed by Lightspeed, which secured $1.3 billion in funding last year. Other major players in the quick-commerce market include Walmart-owned Flipkart (with its "Minutes" service) and Tata Digital-backed BigBasket.Amazon has also entered the Indian quick-commerce market, further intensifying the competitive landscape.To maintain its market leadership, Blinkit is undertaking a significant expansion drive, aiming to operate 1,000 dark stores by March 2025 and 2,000 by December 2026. The company has also recently launched Bistro, a 10-minute food delivery service, to compete with offerings from Swiggy and Zepto.Blinkit recently launched a 10-minute ambulance service in Gurugram, CEO Albinder Dhindsa announced. The ambulances will have medical equipment such as oxygen cylinders, AEDs (Automated External Defibrillator), stretchers, monitors, suction machines, emergency medicines and injections.Blinkit has also opened a temporary store in Maha Kumbh Mela to serve pilgrims and tourists.“This one is a 100 sq ft store which will be delivering in Arail Tent City, Dome City, ITDC Luxury Camp, Devrakh, and other key areas of the Maha Kumbh Mela,” Dhindsa said.
Article Summary: Zomato has further invested Rs 500 crore in its quick-commerce subsidiary, Blinkit. This brings Zomato's total investment in Blinkit to Rs 2,800 crore since acquiring the company in an all-stock deal worth Rs 4,477 crore in August 2022.

Article Title: Microsoft search market share doubles, as Google's share falls just below 90% for the first time
Article Text:
How Google's search market share dropped

Google's dominance in the global search engine market has dipped below 90% for the first time in almost a decade. According to Statcounter, in the last three months of 2024, Google's market share fell to 89.34% in October, 89.99% in November, and 89.74% in December. This marks a significant shift in the search landscape, as Google has consistently held over 90% of the market share for almost a decade.The last time Google's share was below 90% was in early 2015.However, this decline has helped Microsoft 's Bing search engine to experience a major growth in usage during the latter half of 2024, with its market share almost doubling to reach around 4%. This suggests that Bing is slowly gaining popularity, although it still lags significantly behind Google.As per Statcounter data, Google seems to be gradually losing its search market share. The company’s search market share has remained relatively stable in most regions except Asia, which appears to be a significant factor behind the overall decline, the report suggests.In the US, Google’s search market share peaked at 90.37% in November 2024 but dropped to 87.39% by December. For the rest of 2024, the share fluctuated between 86-88%, showing a slight but noticeable decline.Despite dominating the search market for nearly a decade with a consistent 90-92+% share, Google has faced criticism over the growing unhelpfulness of its search results.This, along with allegations of maintaining an illegal monopoly, has placed the company under scrutiny for almost two years.While Google's search market share decline might suggest users are turning to AI-powered search engines like ChatGPT Search and Perplexity, Statcounter's data doesn't specifically mention that. The report primarily tracks traditional search engines like Bing, Yandex, and Yahoo , with a minor "other" category that includes DuckDuckGo and Ecosia.Microsoft's Bing, the second most popular search engine, saw a slight increase in market share, hovering around 4% in the latter half of 2024.It's worth noting that a similar dip in Google's market share in April 2024 turned out to be a data error. However, the consistent decline in the last three months of 2024 suggests a real shift in user behaviour, even if the specific reasons remain unclear.
Article Summary: Google's market share fell to 89.34% in October, 89.99% in November, and 89.74% in December. This marks a significant shift in the search landscape, as Google has consistently held over 90% of the market share for almost a decade. Microsoft's Bing saw a slight increase in market share, hovering around 4% in the latter half of 2024.

Article Title: Chinese telecom manufacturer founded by former Huawei executives faces FBI investigation over security concerns

What are US concerns



What the company says

The US Commerce Department and FBI are investigating Baicells Technologies , a Chinese company by former Huawei executives. According to a Reuters report, the commerce department is looking into the company for national security reasons and has sent legal requests (subpoenas) to it. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is helping with the investigation.Baicells was founded in 2014 by former Huawei executives. The company started its US business in Wisconsin in 2015. It has supplied telecom equipment to mobile networks across all US states.The US government is concerned that Chinese-made equipment could allow hackers to access sensitive data, disrupt services, or carry out cyberattacks. The FBI has also raised concerns in other areas, such as Virginia, where Baicells equipment was used near a naval weapons testing site. The US cybersecurity agency CISA has also issued warnings about vulnerabilities in Baicells equipment that could allow hackers to take control of devices.These investigations show that the U.S. remains worried about Chinese telecom equipment being used for spying, even after cracking down on other Chinese companies like Huawei and ZTE.Sun Lixin – the head of Baicells said the company will fully cooperate with US inquiries and believes its products are safe. "We have taken affirmative steps to ensure the security of our products and proactively address any security concerns," Baicells said when asked about base station vulnerabilities.However, the US Defense Department recently added Baicells to a list of companies linked to China's military.

Article Title: Infosys CEO responds to LinkedIn post claiming toxic work culture and discrimination
Article Text:

Why I Left Infosys Job Without Any Offer Letter in Hand, Despite Being the Sole Breadwinner for My Family

During my time at Infosys, I faced several systemic issues that ultimately forced me to make the difficult decision of leaving without an offer in hand. I want to speak openly about these challenges because they are indicative of larger problems in corporate workplaces:

1. No Financial Growth Despite Promotion: Being promoted from System Engineer to Senior System Engineer sounds good on paper, but it meant nothing without a monetary hike. For three years, I worked hard, met expectations, and contributed to the team, yet saw no financial acknowledgment of my efforts.

2. Unfair Workload Redistribution: When the team size reduced from 50 to 30 due to attrition, the additional workload was simply dumped on the remaining employees. Instead of hiring replacements or providing support, the management took the easy route—overburdening the existing team without compensation or even recognition.

3. Stagnant Career Prospects: The account I was assigned to was a loss-making one, as admitted by my manager. This directly impacted salary hikes and opportunities for career growth. Staying in such an account felt like professional stagnation, with no light at the end of the tunnel.

4. Toxic Client Environment: The client’s unrealistic demands for ultra-quick responses created a toxic work culture where even minor issues led to escalations. This pressure trickled down, creating stress at every level of the hierarchy. It felt like a constant state of firefighting, with no room for personal well-being.

5. Lack of Recognition: Despite consistent efforts and recognition from my peers and seniors, none of it translated into tangible rewards—be it financial growth, promotions, or career advancements. Hard work felt like it was being taken for granted.

6. Onsite Opportunities and Regional Bias: Onsite opportunities were never based on merit but rather on linguistic preferences. Employees speaking Telugu, Tamil, and Malayalam were frequently prioritized for such roles, while Hindi-speaking employees like me were overlooked, regardless of our performance. This blatant bias was both unfair and demoralizing.

These issues aren’t unique to me—they reflect the experiences of countless employees who feel voiceless in the face of such systemic failures. I chose to leave because I couldn’t compromise my self-respect and mental health for an organization that ignored these basic issues.

It’s time corporate managers stop sugarcoating the realities on the ground and start addressing these problems. Employees are not resources to be exploited; they are human beings with aspirations and limits. If such toxic practices continue unchecked, organizations risk losing not only their talent but also their credibility.

Article Title: New H-1B and H-2 visa rules come into effect starting today, January 17: Changes and all other details
Article Text:

What are these new rules about

Where were these rules published

What is the H-2 visa program

What is the goal of the changes to the H-2 program

The US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) implemented new rules to modernize and improve the H-1B and H-2 nonimmigrant visa programs, effective Friday, January 17, 2025. These changes were published in the Federal Register on December 18, 2024. The H-1B program allows American companies to temporarily hire foreign workers in specialty occupations requiring highly specialized knowledge and at least a bachelor's degree (or equivalent).The new H-1B rules aim to streamline the approval process, increases employer flexibility in retaining talent, and enhances program integrity and oversight. While primarily focused on H-1B specialty occupation workers, some provisions also affect other nonimmigrant classifications, including H-2, H-3, F-1, L-1, O, P, Q-1, R-1, E-3, and TN. The current annual cap for H-1B visas stands at 65,000, with an additional 20,000 reserved for those holding advanced degrees from US institutions.The H-2 program covers temporary agricultural (H-2A) and nonagricultural (H-2B) workers. The updated H-2 rule strengthens worker protections by imposing stricter penalties on companies that charge prohibited fees or violate labor laws. It also provides greater flexibility for both H-2A and H-2B workers. The DHS aims to enhance the integrity of the H-2 programs and improve worker protections through these regulatory changes.The US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has implemented new rules to modernize and improve the H-1B (specialty occupations) and H-2 (temporary agricultural and nonagricultural workers) nonimmigrant visa programs.Both rules were published in the Federal Register on December 18, 2024.The H-1B final rule aims to modernize the program by:* Streamlining the approval process. Students on F-1 visas will face fewer disruptions when shifting to H-1B status. F-1 visa students applying for an H-1B visa will benefit from an automatic extension of their F-1 visa until April 1 of that year. This will ensure continuity in lawful status and work authorisation while their H-1B application is under review. USCIS has committed to expediting applications for H-1B extensions to ease the burden on both employers as well as workers.* Increasing flexibility for employers to retain talented workers. Businesses can hire H-1B workers based on documented needs, allowing more adaptable workforce planning. ap-exempt organisations, such as universities and research bodies, can now submit petitions throughout the year without numerical limitations.* Improving the integrity and oversight of the program. The DHS may request supporting documents to verify job authenticity. CWhile the provisions mainly amend regulations for H-1B specialty occupation workers, some provisions also impact other nonimmigrant classifications, including: H-2, H-3, F-1, L-1, O, P, Q-1, R-1, E-3, and TN.The H-2 visa program covers temporary agricultural (H-2A) and temporary nonagricultural (H-2B) nonimmigrant workers.The rule is intended to better ensure the integrity of the H-2 programs and enhance protections for workers. "The H-2 final rule significantly strengthens worker protections by, among other things, imposing new consequences on companies that charge prohibited fees or violate our labor laws, and provides greater flexibility for H-2A and H-2B workers," says release on USCIS website.
Article Summary: The US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has implemented new rules to modernize and improve the H-1B and H-2 nonimmigrant visa programs. The new rules aim to streamline the approval process, increase employer flexibility in retaining talent, and enhances program integrity and oversight.

Article Title: Microsoft to end Microsoft 365 apps support for Windows 10 on this date
Article Text:
Challenges with Windows 11 Adoption

Microsoft extends security updates for Windows 10

Microsoft has announced that its Office apps, now called Microsoft 365 apps, will no longer be supported on Windows 10 starting October 14, 2025. In a blog post, Microsoft stated, “Microsoft 365 Apps will no longer be supported after October 14, 2025, on Windows 10 devices. To use Microsoft 365 Applications on your device, you will need to upgrade to Windows 11 .” The date also marks the end of official support for the Windows 10 operating system. To continue using Microsoft 365 apps without issues, users will need to upgrade to Windows 11.Microsoft says that though after the support ends, the Office apps won’t stop working right away. However, users might face performance and reliability problems over time, the company warns.Microsoft is pushing users to upgrade to Windows 11, calling 2025 “the year of the Windows 11 PC refresh.” Speaking at CES, Yusuf Mehdi, Microsoft’s executive vice president and consumer chief marketing officer, emphasized the importance of upgrading:“We believe that one of the most important pieces of technology people will look to refresh in 2025 isn’t the refrigerator, the television or their mobile phone. It will be their Windows 10 PC, and they will move forward with Windows 11”.Many Windows 10 users haven’t switched to Windows 11 yet, partly because older PCs don’t meet the strict hardware requirements. For instance, Windows 11 demands a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) 2.0, which Microsoft says is “non-negotiable.” Gamers too are reluctant to switch to Windows 11, citing concerns about compatibility and performance.To encourage users to upgrade, Microsoft has started showing full-screen prompts suggesting they buy new PCs.While the support for Windows 10 will end this year, Microsoft is offering Extended Security Updates (ESUs) for the first time. Consumers can pay $30 for an extra year of updates, while businesses can purchase up to three years of extended support.As the October 2025 deadline approaches, Microsoft is making it clear that upgrading to Windows 11 is essential for a seamless experience with its apps and services.
Article Summary: Microsoft 365 apps will no longer be supported on Windows 10 starting October 14, 2025. The date also marks the end of official support for the Windows 10 operating system. Microsoft is pushing users to upgrade to Windows 11, calling 2025 “the year of the Windows 11 PC refresh”

Article Title: Apple products lost in the LA fire may not be covered by AppleCare+, here’s why
Article Text:
Representative Image

What AppleCare+ policies say about fire damages



What it means for users



Victims affected by the Los Angeles wildfire who lost their Macs may have to look to their homeowner's insurance for replacement, not AppleCare. While AppleCare offers protection against certain damages, it generally doesn't cover fire damage. The wildfires in California have caused widespread property loss, including homes, businesses, and personal belongings. Thousands of people have been affected, and those needing to replace their Macs will likely find better support through their homeowner's insurance policies. Apple 's AppleCare+ for Mac has specific terms outlining what is and isn't covered for repairs.Similar to other warranties and insurance policies, the agreement clearly states its limitations.The "What is not Covered?" section of the AppleCare+ policy agreement lists scenarios that won’t be covered includes damage caused by "accident, abuse, misuse, liquid contact, fire, earthquake or other external causes." This means damage from fire, or even water damage from firefighting efforts, will not covered.Submitting a Mac for repair or replacement after it has survived a house fire, even if it appears intact externally, will likely be rejected. Additionally, if your house was evacuated as a precaution but left unscathed by the fire, it could still become a target for theft. The policy explicitly states it does not cover "lost or stolen" hardware, noting, "This Plan only covers Covered Equipment that is returned to Apple in its entirety."Apart from this, the company is offering other support to those affected by the LA wildfires. Apple Card users in FEMA-designated disaster areas can defer payments without interest accrual by contacting Apple Card Support.Additionally, Apple CEO Tim Cook announced that Apple is donating to support wildfire victims and recovery efforts.While AppleCare is helpful for typical Mac issues, it's not a comprehensive insurance plan and has limitations. It's designed to cover repairs for specific problems, not for events like natural disasters or theft. For broader protection, insurance is the more appropriate solution.Instead, Mac owners affected by wildfires should turn to homeowner's or renter's insurance, which typically covers property damage and loss, including electronics. Businesses can use property insurance for similar claims, while travellers should review their travel insurance policies for coverage of damaged or lost items.
Article Summary: AppleCare+ for Mac has specific terms outlining what is and isn't covered for repairs. While AppleCare offers protection against certain damages, it generally doesn't cover fire damage. Instead, Mac owners affected by wildfires should turn to homeowner's or renter's insurance.

Article Title: How Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg used YouTube to defend his company
Article Text:
What Zuckerberg said to defend Meta



“For example, YouTube, I think, may end up hosting some stuff that people pirate for some period of time, but YouTube is trying to take that stuff down. And the vast majority of the stuff on YouTube, I would assume, is kind of good and they have the license to do.”

What Zuckerberg said about Meta using LibGen



“I get that you’re trying to get me to give an opinion of LibGen, which I haven’t really heard of. It’s just that I don’t have knowledge of that specific thing.”

Facebook-parent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has used YouTube 's battle against piracy to defend his company's use of copyrighted ebooks for AI training. According to newly released excerpts from a deposition (seen by Techcrunch), which was a part of the Kadrey v. Meta lawsuit , Zuckerberg’s defence highlighted the ongoing legal debate surrounding the "fair use" of copyrighted content for AI training , a claim disputed by many copyright holders.This is one of many cases where authors and IP holders are challenging AI companies over their use of copyrighted material.During his deposition, Zuckerberg said:While a full transcript remains unavailable, excerpts from Zuckerberg's deposition shed light on his views regarding copyright and fair use in AI development. Zuckerberg seems to defend Meta's use of the "LibGen" dataset, a collection of copyrighted ebooks, to train its Llama AI models.LibGen, a self-described "links aggregator," provides access to copyrighted works from major publishers and has faced numerous lawsuits and fines for copyright infringement. Despite concerns within Meta's AI teams about the legal implications, Zuckerberg allegedly approved the use of LibGen for training at least one Llama model.The plaintiffs' counsel, representing authors like Sarah Silverman and Ta-Nehisi Coates, highlighted internal concerns within Meta about using the LibGen dataset. According to a legal filing, Meta employees referred to LibGen as a "data set we know to be pirated" and warned that its use "may undermine (the company’s)] negotiating position with regulators."However, during his deposition, Zuckerberg claimed he "hadn't really heard of" LibGen. He said:When questioned by one of the plaintiffs' attorneys, David Boies, about the company's use of the LibGen dataset. Zuckerberg defended Meta's use of the dataset, arguing that prohibiting the use of such resources for AI training would be unreasonable.“So would I want to have a policy against people using YouTube because some of the content may be copyrighted? No. [T]here are cases where having such a blanket ban might not be the right thing to do,” he said.“You know, [if there’s] someone who’s providing a website and they’re intentionally trying to violate people’s rights … obviously it’s something that we would want to be cautious about or careful about how we engaged with it or maybe even prevent our teams from engaging with it,” Zuckerberg added.
Article Summary: Mark Zuckerberg used YouTube's battle against piracy to defend Meta's use of copyrighted ebooks for AI training. Zuckerberg's defence highlighted the ongoing legal debate surrounding the "fair use" of copyrighted content forAI training. While a full transcript remains unavailable, excerpts from Zuckerberg's deposition shed light on his views.

Article Title: UK has this deadline for all adult websites, 3 key things they are required to do
Article Text:
What the companies have to do

Children's access assessment:

Protecting children on social media platforms:

Age verification for pornographic content:

The UK's media regulator, Ofcom , has issued guidelines requiring all websites hosting porn, or adult material, including social media platforms, to implement “robust” age-verification checks for users in the region.According to the guidelines, these measures, which include demanding photo ID or conducting credit card checks, must be in place by July.The new rules, implemented under the Online Safety Act (OSA), aim to prevent children from easily accessing pornography online.“For too long, many online services which allow porn and other harmful material have ignored the fact that children are accessing their services,” said Ofcom chief executive Melanie Dawes.“Either they don’t ask or, when they do, the checks are minimal and easy to avoid. That means companies have effectively been treating all users as if they’re adults, leaving children potentially exposed to porn and other types of harmful content. Today, this starts to change,” Dawes added.Key requirements and deadlines for online services under the Online Safety Act include:All user-to-user services and search services must conduct a children's access assessment within three months (by April 16, 2025) to determine if the service or any part of it is likely to be accessed by children. Services that are likely to be accessed by children must comply with children's risk assessment duties and children's safety duties.Ofcom will publish Protection of Children Codes and children's risk assessment guidance in April 2025. Services likely to be accessed by children must conduct a children's risk assessment within three months of the guidance publication (by July 2025). Based on the risk assessment, services must implement measures to protect children, such as introducing age checks.All services that allow pornography must have highly effective age assurance processes in place by July 2025. Services that publish their own pornographic content, including certain Generative AI tools, must begin implementing robust age checks immediately.“As age checks start to roll out in the coming months, adults will start to notice a difference in how they access certain online services. Services which host their own pornography must start to introduce age checks immediately, while other user-to-user services – including social media - which allow pornography and certain other types of content harmful to children will have to follow suit by July at the latest,” Dawes added.
Article Summary: UK's media regulator, Ofcom, has issued guidelines requiring all websites hosting porn, or adult material, to implement “robust” age-verification checks for users in the region. The new rules, implemented under the Online Safety Act (OSA), aim to prevent children from easily accessing pornography online.

Article Title: Donald Trump may have this plan to save TikTok from shutdown
Article Text:
Trump is ‘famous’ on TikTok

Donald Trump is reportedly considering an executive order to delay the TikTok ban, providing its China-based parent company Bytedance some time to negotiate a sale or find an alternative solution for the Chinese-owned app, which is likely to be banned in the US on Sunday (December 19).According to a report by The Washington Post, the President-elect is considering an executive order that would suspend enforcement of the TikTok ban-or-sale law for 60 to 90 days once he takes office.This effort, however, is legally questionable, the report added.“Trump has been mulling ways to save the day for the wildly popular video app, talking through unconventional dealmaking and legal maneuvers such as an executive order that would unravel the law passed by Congress last year with bipartisan support,” the report cited two people familiar with the deliberations as saying.The report says that Trump is keen on being seen as rescuing a platform where he is widely admired. This has led political aides and business allies to scramble for options to fulfill his campaign promise to “save TikTok,” as he has mentioned repeatedly on his TikTok account, which boasts over 14 million followers.“I have a warm spot in my heart for TikTok,” Trump said last month. The main challenge is how to achieve this. One source mentioned that Trump is eager to be seen as “making a deal,” after he assumed office.A law signed by President Joe Biden last year requires the app’s owner, Beijing-based tech giant ByteDance, to sell the app by January 19 – just one day before Trump’s inauguration – or face an immediate ban. The Supreme Court, which considered TikTok's challenge of the law last week, is expected to allow the law to proceed but has not yet issued a ruling.
Article Summary: Donald Trump is reportedly considering an executive order to delay the TikTok ban. The President-elect is keen on being seen as rescuing a platform where he is widely admired. A law signed by President Biden last year requires the app’s owner, Beijing-based tech giant ByteDance, to sell the app by January 19.

Article Title: Apple hits a new record in India, joins the Big 5 Club
Article Text:
Representative Image

Apple's India Success Story

Apple has achieved a significant milestone in India, breaking into the top five smartphone brands for the first time since it began selling iPhones in the country. This is particularly noteworthy given India's price-conscious market. According to a report in Economic Times, during the crucial festive season of September-December 2024, Apple secured a 9-10% market share, a historic high for the company in India, according to preliminary data from IDC and Counterpoint Research.This success is said to be partly attributed to Apple's increasing localization efforts. The company now manufactures the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max in India through Foxconn and Pegatron. Furthermore, it's expanding AirPods component production in Pune and plans to begin full AirPods manufacturing in Telangana by 2025. Apple's India-made product range, which already includes iPads and MacBooks, continues to grow, even as some iPad production shifts to Vietnam. The Indian government is actively encouraging further local iPad assembly.Apple's financial performance in India reflects this growth. In FY2023-24, net profit rose 23% to Rs 2,745.7 crore, while revenue increased by 36% to Rs 67,121.6 crore, driven by strong iPhone sales. Analysts predict continued growth in both sales and profits for the current fiscal year.In 2024, Apple shipped over 12 million iPhones in India, representing substantial year-on-year growth of 34-35% compared to the 9 million units shipped in 2023, according to preliminary data from IDC and echoed by Counterpoint Research.The overall Indian smartphone market also saw growth, with IDC estimating over 38 million units shipped in Q4 2024, a 5-6% year-on-year increase, following a strong 46 million-unit shipment in Q3 2024.
Article Summary: Apple broke into the top five smartphone brands for the first time since it began selling iPhones in the country. During the crucial festive season of September-December 2024, Apple secured a 9-10% market share. Apple's India-made product range, which already includes iPads and MacBooks, continues to grow.

Article Title: National Startup Day: Startup CEOs celebrate spirit of entrepreneurship
Article Text: January 16 is celebrated as the National Startup Day . In the year 2016. the Indian government established the Startup India initiative on this very day. Since then, the country's startup ecosystem has made great strides, becoming the third largest in the world and transforming India from a nation of job seekers to job creators. On January 16 2025, India celebrates the 9th anniversary of National Startup Day.Vaibhav Kaushik , Co-founder & CEO, NawgatiOver the past few years, the Indian startup ecosystem has undergone a remarkable transformation. This shift is largely due to a change in the mindset of founders, who are now more focused on solving real problems rather than simply creating solutions for the masses. Alongside this, the influx of institutional funding and the surge in the number of unicorns have inspired many aspiring entrepreneurs to take the leap and launch their own ventures. I also believe that startups have played a pivotal role in driving India's growth. One of the most significant contributions has been the generation of employment—startups across the country have created jobs for lakhs of people. This has made them a key driver of economic progress in recent years.Sunil Shekhawat , CEO of SanchiconnectIn recent years, there has been a significant shift in the profile of individuals taking the entrepreneurial plunge. Earlier, we predominantly saw college graduates and freshers leading the charge as budding entrepreneurs. However, today, the average age of Indian entrepreneurs has notably increased, reflecting a broader spectrum of maturity and experience among those stepping into this space.A few years ago, startups were not considered a mainstream career option for graduates or those pursuing higher studies. Today, it is a matter of immense pride for the nation that entrepreneurship is widely recognised and accepted as a legitimate and respected career path. Many individuals now aspire to become entrepreneurs right from the onset of their professional journeys.Shashank Dubey, Co-founder and Chief Revenue Officer, TredenceThe future of business lies in sustainable, inclusive growth powered by AI technology. While the critical last-mile problem poses challenges in 2025, emerging tech companies are stepping up with innovative and effective solutions. Overcoming this challenge will unlock significant ROI and revenue opportunities for businesses.Karan Bhargava, Founder & CEO of Homoeo AmigoOn National Startup Day, we celebrate the incredible growth of India's startup ecosystem, which has now become one of the largest and most dynamic in the world. With over 100 unicorns and thousands of emerging startups, India has positioned itself as a global hub of innovation and entrepreneurship. The nation's startups are not only driving advancements in technology but are also revolutionizing critical sectors like healthcare. In recent years, we've witnessed a surge of health-tech innovations that are improving accessibility, affordability, and quality of healthcare across the country. As we move forward,the entrepreneurial spirit of India will continue to create lasting change, paving the way for a brighter, healthier future. Here’s to the spirit of the start-ups-continue to grow, innovate and inspire!Vaibhav Gupta, Co-founder and CPO, KlugKlugIndia's startup ecosystem has experienced remarkable growth in recent years, solidifying its position as the world's third-largest. As of January 15, 2025, the country boasts over 1.59 lakh (159,000) DPIIT-recognized startups, a monumental rise from just 500 in 2016. This expansion is further highlighted by the increasing number of unicorns.Jaspreet Bindra , Co-founder, AI&BeyondOver the past decade, India has established itself as a global startup hub, fueled by initiatives like Startup India, Digital India , and Atmanirbhar Bharat. These programs have driven job creation, with startups like Zomato, Swiggy, and Paytm not only employing thousands but also pioneering the gig economy and redefining work culture. Startups have also spearheaded technological advancements, introducing AI, blockchain, IoT, and space tech, while billions in global venture capital have significantly bolstered the economy. Beyond this, they have driven social progress by enhancing financial inclusion, democratizing education and healthcare, and creating opportunities for underserved communities. Perhaps most notably, there has been a cultural shift in how entrepreneurship is perceived. The traditional preference for secure jobs has evolved, with society increasingly embracing risk-taking and innovation, marking a transformative decade for India’s economy and mindset.Saket Chirania, Co-Founder, AgrizyNational Startup Day is a tribute to the relentless passion and ingenuity of entrepreneurs across diverse sectors. It inspires startups to push boundaries, foster innovation, and bring transformative ideas to life. In India, the agritech sector is experiencing unprecedented growth, with startups harnessing advanced technologies like AI, ML, and IoT to revolutionize the entire agrifood value chain. These innovations not only empower farmers and other stakeholders but also contribute to the broader digital transformation, further strengthening India's dynamic startup ecosystem.Niraj Kumar, CTO, OnixOn this National Startup Day, we celebrate the transformative power of innovation and the pivotal role startups play in shaping the future. Artificial intelligence, in particular, has emerged as a game-changing force, revolutionizing industries and creating new possibilities.Zaiba Sarang, Co-founder, iThink LogisticsIndia is the proud hub of some of the world’s most dynamic and fastest-growing startups, fueled by a rapidly evolving end-user base and an ever-adaptive business environment. These startups have become vital pillars of India’s economic progress, showcasing innovation, resilience, and creativity on a global scale. National Startup Day has amplified this momentum, igniting entrepreneurial passion across the country as thousands of startups emerge each year, turning bold ideas into transformative ventures. With enhanced government support, forward-thinking initiatives, and streamlined regulations, the Indian startup ecosystem is now poised for even greater heights. The declaration of January 16th as National Startup Day is more than just a date—it’s a resounding acknowledgment of the innovation and determination driving India’s entrepreneurial spirit. It serves as a beacon of inspiration, encouraging future founders to dream big and contribute to the nation’s vibrant economic landscape.Dhruvil Sanghvi, Founder & CEO of LogiNextNational Startup Day is a powerful acknowledgment of the immense potential of entrepreneurship in India. It plays a vital role in driving innovation, creating employment opportunities, and propelling economic growth. As an entrepreneur, I am deeply grateful for the unwavering support of the Government of India in fostering a thriving startup ecosystem. The success of initiatives like ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce) is particularly inspiring, showcasing how innovative startups can revolutionize industries such as logistics and commerce. This is a testament to the transformative power of collaboration, technology, and visionary entrepreneurship.
Article Summary: January 16 is celebrated as the National Startup Day. In the year 2016, the Indian government established the Startup India initiative on this very day.
